intro: Pilosocereus estevesii, commonly known as the Estevés cactus, is a species native to Brazil. It is a columnar cactus characterized by its spiny, ribbed stems and is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces white flowers during the warmer months, which are often nocturnal in bloom. It has a slow growth rate and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions. Pilosocereus estevesii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience.
